intro: Tridactyle brevicalcarata, commonly known as the short-spined tridactyle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves with three leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
